metadata.synopsis: Astarion and the player he's in a romantic relationship with talk in a private bedroom in an inn, the morning after spending the night together after saving the world. A discussion of what comes next ensues, varying depending on how Astarion's story unfolded. He could:- Have killed Cazador and taken power to become the Vampire Ascendant.- Have killed Cazador and stayed a spawn (with reactivity to whether or not he killed the Spawn Prisoners.)- Not killed Cazador.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: It feels so good. Freedom - true freedom. Finally.
83.context: NodeContext: 'different' - player is a mind flayer now. Astarion's not impressed with the look, but is very hungry for their power

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: It feels so good. Freedom - true freedom. Finally.
80.context: NodeContext: 'different' - player is a mind flayer now. Astarion's not impressed with the look, but is very hungry for their power

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: I can feel my strength growing. Every day that passes, I gain new abilities.
141.context: NodeContext: 'different' - player is a mind flayer now. Astarion's not impressed with the look, but is very hungry for their power

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: And you've changed too, of course. A... different aesthetic, but with such power.
13.context: NodeContext: 'different' - player is a mind flayer now. Astarion's not impressed with the look, but is very hungry for their power

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: A shame. I was looking forward to having you as my consort. But we can still be powerful allies.
43.context: NodeContext: Astarion's taking the player in, liking the potential in them

167.speaker: Astarion
167.text: Yes. We will be powerful allies.
167.context: NodeContext: Astarion's taking the player in, liking the potential in them

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Allies? I thought we were friends. More than friends, even.

181.speaker: Astarion
181.text: Haha! Oh darling, please. I can't have something like this as my lover. The mechanics alone...

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: No, a simple alliance is far more useful to us both.

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: I can build up my power here in the light, while you lurk below in the shadows.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: Very well. If that's what you want.

253.speaker: Astarion
253.text: Oh, don't be like that. You can't have thought we'd stay together.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: It would never work, sweetie. Not when I look like this and you... well, you're monstrous.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: And it's such a pity, because you were beautiful. You would have looked magnificent ruling by my side.

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: But just because you're a monster, it doesn't mean we don't have a glorious future ahead of us.
177.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player.]

260.speaker: Astarion
260.text: So come on, darling. Let's show this world what monsters can do.
260.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player.]

197.speaker: Player
197.text: True, we could help each other.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: Exactly my thought! Together, we can rule this city, and the cattle won't even realise it's happening.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You'd discard me, just like that?

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: I'm offering you a chance to be useful - to be more than the monster you've become. I thought you'd be grateful.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: But if you won't accept my kindness, that's on your slimy head.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: It is a shame, though. You were something special.

137.speaker: Astarion
137.text: I'll never forget the person you used to be - the beauty I bedded, the warrior I fought beside, the hero that saved this city.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: The people may not appreciate you now that you're a grotesque freak, but I do.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: After all, you helped me attain perfection. I owe all of this to you, so... thank you.

149.speaker: Astarion
149.text: Now get the hells out of my city.
149.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player]

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I don't think so. I have my own plans.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: Excuse me? What plans? Lurking in the sewers, feasting on rat brains?

256.speaker: Astarion
256.text: But fine - if you want to make your own future, have at it. And if you crash and burn, that's on your slimy head.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Yes, I can work below the surface - you can work above.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: No. I am beyond your petty power games.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Excuse me? These are the only games worth playing.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: But fine. You don't need my friendship and I don't need you sliming around my palace.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I am no longer your spawn. I will choose my own path.

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: Really? And what does your path include? Lurking in the sewers, feasting on rat brains?

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: A pity you won't be here to see it.
135.context: NodeContext: Realising Karlach is going to die, not really accepting it.

190.speaker: Astarion
190.text: My love, stuck with this ticking time bomb in your chest. It's nothing short of a tragedy.
190.context: NodeContext: Realising Karlach is going to die, not really accepting it.

227.speaker: Astarion
227.context: NodeContext: Realising Karlach is going to die, not really accepting it.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Like I'm going to blow at any minute.
55.context: NodeContext: Realising Karlach is going to die, not really accepting it.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: It's too soon - we need more time together. You need to live your life, damn it.
31.context: NodeContext: Realising Karlach is going to die, not really accepting it.

259.speaker: Astarion
259.text: So return to the Hells and do it - live.
259.context: NodeContext: Hesitates a moment, but then commits.

209.speaker: Astarion
209.text: After all, Raphael's gone to wage war against Zariel. She'll be too busy fighting him to come after you.
209.context: NodeContext: Hesitates a moment, but then commits.

214.speaker: Astarion
214.text: I'd - I'd even come with you. We can cut our way through the Hells together.
214.context: NodeContext: Hesitates a moment, but then commits.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: You can't, Astarion. Avernus is a hellscape - literally.
255.context: NodeContext: A little aloof, but not angry or cruel

143.speaker: Astarion
143.text: Oh, I've heard. But isn't that part of the fun? Bringing chaos to a whole new realm?

218.speaker: Astarion
218.text: Not to mention, I am the Vampire Ascendant. Where else could I find a worthy challenge?

261.speaker: Player
261.text: All right. I'll do it. Back to the Hells - together.

219.speaker: Player
219.context: NodeContext: A little aloof, but not angry or cruel

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: Why not? Life wouldn't taste half as sweet without you by my side.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: No - I swore I'd never go back, and I meant it. I just want to see the sky one last time.
49.context: NodeContext: A little aloof, but not angry or cruel

188.speaker: Astarion
188.text: Very well, then. Die if you want to, I will carry on regardless.
188.context: NodeContext: A little aloof, but not angry or cruel

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: I will miss you, though. Since the moment we met, you have been spectacular.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: I will see you again, my love. I'm not sure how, but if I know anything, it's that death isn't always the end.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: Who knows - perhaps we've only just begun.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Concentrate. You can barely hear him through the blaze of chaos threatening to explode from within.
151.context: NodeContext: Rudely asking "Karlach? I asked how are you feeling?" but then realises what's wrong - the engine in her chest is overheating and will kill her.

222.speaker: Astarion
222.text: Karlach? I asked how are -... No. Not your engine.
222.context: NodeContext: Rudely asking "Karlach? I asked how are you feeling?" but then realises what's wrong - the engine in her chest is overheating and will kill her.

160.speaker: Astarion
160.text: You know, now that our enemies have fallen, I might be the most powerful person in the world.

234.speaker: Astarion
234.text: And as you're my consort, that makes us the most powerful people in the world.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: And that makes us the most powerful couple in the world.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I wouldn't want it any other way.
174.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: And neither would I. Together, we can do anything.
27.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

231.speaker: Astarion
231.text: The world is ours for the taking. So, what would you like?
231.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I want to see the world, with you at my side.
63.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: Then you shall. We'll travel the lands together, tasting everything Faerûn has to offer.

263.speaker: Astarion
263.text: Perhaps we'll find somewhere we'd like to stay for a century or two - perhaps not.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I want to live forever. Make me a vampire.
74.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: My sweet, I thought you'd never ask.
35.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

211.speaker: Astarion
211.text: Of course, you will be a spawn before you can become a true vampire, but that's a small detail.
211.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

98.speaker: Player
98.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Then we'll do it tonight. And come the morning, we will be together forever.
2.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: We have a beautiful, bloody future to look forward to, my love. I can't be sure what it holds for us, but I know one thing.
72.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: This is going to be fun.
96.context: NodeContext: With a wicked smile [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

75.speaker: Player
75.text: And you promise you'll make me a full vampire soon?
75.context: NodeContext: overly sincere - he doesn't really mean it

180.speaker: Astarion
180.text: My darling, of course! I want nothing more.
180.context: NodeContext: overly sincere - he doesn't really mean it

252.speaker: Player
252.text: Actually, no. This isn't what I want.

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: This isn't what you want yet. I'm sure you'll come around in your own good time.

117.speaker: Astarion
117.text: But until the moment's right, we can still be together. We can still taste all the delights of this world.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: We'll start with Baldur's Gate - Let's make this city ours.
11.context: NodeContext: Genuine laugh - the player can't get away from him. Not even if they want to.

185.speaker: Astarion
185.text: Oh, darling. I love the way you think.

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: We will need to be careful, of course. There are still powerful forces in the city.

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: Not least of whom is our friend, the new Grand Duke.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Let's put our enemies to the sword!
7.context: NodeContext: Genuine laugh - the player can't get away from him. Not even if they want to.

217.speaker: Astarion
217.text: Just when I thought I couldn't love you any more.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: I think we should break up.
248.context: NodeContext: Genuine laugh - the player can't get away from him. Not even if they want to.

258.speaker: Astarion
258.text: Hahaha! Don't be stupid, darling. You're mine, remember?
258.context: NodeContext: Genuine laugh - the player can't get away from him. Not even if they want to.

178.speaker: Astarion
178.text: The tadpole is gone, which means your future is mine to decide.

250.speaker: Astarion
250.text: How lucky you are that I chose you as my consort. Chose you to help me take Baldur's Gate, then sit by my side as I rule it.

195.speaker: Astarion
195.text: There's no backing out now - we'll be together forever. I can promise you that.

207.speaker: Astarion
207.text: Excuse me? You want to leave - now? At my moment of triumph? Have you lost your mind?!
207.context: NodeContext: Trying to grasp what's just been said

140.speaker: Astarion
140.text: You stupid, ungrateful, little- Fine. Fine! To hells with you, I'll take Baldur's Gate myself.
140.context: NodeContext: Manages to rein in his rage, but is still very tense

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: I don't need you - I don't need anyone. I already have everything I want.

165.speaker: Astarion
165.text: As for you... I wish you well. I'm sure you'll land on your feet.
165.context: NodeContext: trying to get on the high horse

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Perhaps we'll even meet again someday. The future is yet to be written, after all.
77.context: NodeContext: Not a threat, but not NOT a threat

136.speaker: Player
136.text: So let's put our new-found power to use.

166.speaker: Astarion
166.text: My love. You always know the right thing to say.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: I wouldn't subdue the world in Bhaal's name - I'll subdue it in ours.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Really? Because Shadowheart has the ear of a literal god.

232.speaker: Astarion
232.text: True, she could be a threat.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I don't know - Wyll's a Grand Duke. That's pretty powerful...

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: True, he has a lot of power at his fingertips. He could be a threat.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I don't know - Wyll's the Blade of Avernus. Pretty powerful...

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: True, if he ever branches out from fighting the Infernal, he'd be a formidable threat.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: The Absolute may be gone, but others will rise against us. Maybe even our old allies.
33.context: NodeContext: Reflective on the last line

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: We may need a purge or two. Just to secure our position.
130.context: NodeContext: "of course I don't WANT to kill our friends. But..."

254.speaker: Player
254.text: We're not killing our friends, Astarion!
254.context: NodeContext: "of course I don't WANT to kill our friends. But..."

122.speaker: Astarion
122.text: Well of course I don't want to. But if they get in my way...
122.context: NodeContext: "of course I don't WANT to kill our friends. But..."

262.speaker: Astarion
262.text: Let's hope they have more sense than that.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Anyway, taking power in this city will need to be a subtle process. We wouldn't want to spook the cattle, after all.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: We can start slowly - quietly charming and manipulating key figures, building up our network of puppets.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: Before long we'll have our hands on every string in this city, and they will dance however we tell them to.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Why not go somewhere new? It's a big world out there.

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: It is indeed. We can travel the lands together, tasting everything Faerûn has to offer.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: You could make me a vampire. Then we'd be even stronger together.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Why stop at two? We could bring this city to its knees.

121.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

128.speaker: Astarion
128.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

228.speaker: Astarion
228.text: I was just thinking about freedom.
228.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

220.speaker: Astarion
220.text: How I'm free of Cazador. How I have a whole new life stretching out in front of me, and you're-...
220.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

95.speaker: Astarion
95.text: How neither one of us is free. How Cazador's still out there, and you're-...
95.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: Well, what are you? Is the person I loved still in there?
105.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

82.speaker: Player
82.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: I'm glad. Although I'm not sure what the expectations are around... us?
153.context: NodeContext: Genuinely glad. 'us' referring to your relationship together.

201.speaker: Astarion
201.text: Do you still want to be together?
201.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

146.speaker: Player
146.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

239.speaker: Astarion
239.text: As much as I want to, I'm not sure if I can.

216.speaker: Player
216.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

154.speaker: Astarion
154.text: I don't know, it is a big change. And as much as I care for you... I don't know.
154.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: Maybe it's better if we're friends for now? You're precious to me and I don't want to lose you, but this is a lot.
233.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: Perhaps we'll adjust, perhaps we won't, but you mean too much for me to walk away.
97.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

213.speaker: Player
213.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

202.speaker: Astarion
202.text: So would I. And I hope we can find some place for love in our new - whatever this is.

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: But even if we can't, I'll never forget the person you were. I'll never forget what you did for this world.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Maybe it's better if we part.
37.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: A pity, because we were rather excellent together. A love for the ages...
84.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: I'll never forget you. I'll never forget what you did for this world.
10.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: And what you did for me.
62.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

139.speaker: Astarion
139.text: Thank you, my love. Thank you.
139.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

241.speaker: Player
241.text: I don't think that would be right for either of us.

148.speaker: Astarion
148.text: No, I think you're right. It's probably best to leave things here.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I am, but I'm more than that. I have evolved beyond the person I was.

189.speaker: Astarion
189.text: I see. And how does this newly-evolved version of you feel about me?

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I shed that person when I shed their skin.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: How I'm free of Cazador. How I have a whole new life stretching out in front of me, and you... you won't be able to join me, will you?

212.speaker: Astarion
212.text: It isn't fair. Not after everything we've been through.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: It isn't fair. It just... is what it is.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: Maybe, but life is what you make it. And I want to make mine with you.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: You can't want to die like this, Karlach. Not when you could still go back to the Hells. Not when you could still live.

158.speaker: Astarion
158.text: And if we did it together - if I came with you - who knows what we'd achieve?

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: I mean it, this is what I want. And it's the smart move.

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: Think about it: in the Hells I never have to fear the sun, I can kill anyone I want, and I'll be with you.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Are you sure about this? The Hells are a horrific place.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: Don't threaten me with a good time, darling.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: I swore I'd never go back. I haven't changed my mind.

170.speaker: Astarion
170.text: This would be different, Karlach. Together, we can face anything - no matter what Avernus throws at us.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: And Zariel will be far too busy with Raphael to worry about scouring the plane for you.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Plus, Cazador could search for a thousand years and never find me there.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: So, Karlach... What do you say?

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Then what are we waiting for, darling?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I just can't, Astarion. I'd rather die here, in my home, than try to survive the Hells. I just want to see the sky one last time.
46.context: NodeContext: Just heard that his love is determined to let herself die, rather than fighting on in Hell

147.speaker: Astarion
147.text: All right. If that's what you want.
147.context: NodeContext: Just heard that his love is determined to let herself die, rather than fighting on in Hell

159.speaker: Astarion
159.text: But you won't get rid of me so easily, my love. Death isn't always the end of life - that much I know for certain.
159.context: NodeContext: Still processing his love's impending death

229.speaker: Astarion
229.text: Who knows - perhaps we've only just begun.
229.context: NodeContext: Still processing his love's impending death

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Then you'd better live that new life of yours to the fullest. Live enough for both of us.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: And I intend to. I can go anywhere, do anything, indulge in whatever hedonism or carnage I like. Once I stay out of the sun.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: So I was thinking; where can I go that is devoid of sunlight, filled with violence, and has the one person I want to spend all my time with?

225.speaker: Player
225.text: You still have a life to live. Embrace it, my love.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Say nothing. Concentrate on keeping the inferno inside you from boiling over.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: I see what's happening, Karlach. The end is coming. But it doesn't have to look like this.

171.speaker: Astarion
171.text: How neither one of us is free. How Cazador's still out there - how you're... you're coming to the end, aren't you?

210.speaker: Astarion
210.text: How I'm free of the parasite - free of Cazador. How I'll never be in someone's power again.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: We've dealt with the parasite. And you dealt with Cazador. I'll never be in someone's power again.

245.speaker: Astarion
245.text: And all it cost was my life in the sun. Now I belong to the shadows.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: We make a good team - let's go be heroes together.

208.speaker: Astarion
208.text: We are rather good together, aren't we? I never saw myself as a hero, but fighting alongside you has been special.

152.speaker: Astarion
152.text: Maybe we could make a difference out there. Although, I do need to ask...

175.speaker: Player
175.text: We should find the vampire spawn in the Underdark. They'll need guidance.

204.speaker: Astarion
204.text: True, the spawn will need someone to lead them. Otherwise they'll just be a murderous, blood-sucking horde.

223.speaker: Astarion
223.text: Although, I couldn't help but notice you said 'we' should find them.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I'll help you find a way to walk in the sun again.
52.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: You - do you think it's possible? I suppose there is a chance.
215.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: And if there's a chance, no matter how small, I'm going to take it.
71.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: And it would mean setting off on another adventure together.
110.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: Is that what you want? Is this what you want?
17.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Let's settle down somewhere and enjoy the peace.
29.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

221.speaker: Astarion
221.text: That does sound tediously boring. Although, if it's with you... maybe?
221.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: And I'm sure trouble would find us sooner or later. It always seems to.
19.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: I just need to be sure - is this what you want? I mean... this.
65.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: I might be free of the parasite, but Cazador's still out there. Without the tadpole's protection, he just has to find me to claim me.
186.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

249.speaker: Astarion
249.text: It might be days or years, but he'll come for me eventually. He's inevitable.
249.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: When the time comes, we'll kill him together.
118.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: True, if we can kill a Netherbrain, we can kill anything.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Why wait? Let's go kill him.
163.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: It's more of a gamble without the tadpoles, but maybe you're right. The best defence is a timely murder...

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Let's leave Baldur's Gate. He can't control you if he can't find you.
193.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: True, it's a vast world out there; there are plenty of places to hide.
18.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: Are you sure you want to do this, though? I mean... this?
182.context: NodeContext: "This" referring to "us being in a relationship". Maybe with a "you and me" hand gesture.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: I would understand if you wanted to go your own way.
16.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

132.speaker: Player
132.text: No, this is what I want.
132.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Being free to choose love, choose a new family - that is my own way.
38.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

240.speaker: Astarion
240.text: Good, because selfless as I am, I really did not want to let you go.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Eh, let's see what happens. Life is a big adventure.
26.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: It certainly is when you're around.
14.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

138.speaker: Astarion
138.text: We are rather excellent together, you know. And united, there is nothing we can't do.
138.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: I can't say what the future holds for us, but I know we'll be facing it together.
9.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: And we're going to have a lot of fun.
123.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Actually, I will go and do my own thing.
30.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: You - what? I didn't think you'd actually agree!
44.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

115.speaker: Astarion
115.text: How dare you! After all I've done for you - after everything I've sacrificed!
115.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: But fine. If that's what you want, so be it.
176.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

192.speaker: Astarion
192.text: There are thousands of vampire spawn in the Underdark, just waiting for a leader. I'll find them.
192.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: I wish you well out there. Just don't come knocking on my door - I'll have a lot of hungry mouths to feed.
155.context: NodeContext: A little bitter, but more a warning than a threat

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: I can make my own way in the world. There's enough of it out there.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: And now I can see it all. At night, obviously.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: It is a pity, we were rather good together. I'll never forget it.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.context: NodeContext: [Note - this is one of the last lines you can say to the player. Make it count :P]

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: I'll find some nice, dark place where neither you nor Cazador will ever bother me again.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Can't we enjoy ourselves for one day before worrying about the next threat?

244.speaker: Astarion
244.text: I suppose you're right. We've been through enough.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I want to break up with you.

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: You - what? Now? After all this?!
